title: Palkhi Festival
subtitle: A Sacred Pilgrimage of Devotion and Faith
overview: The Palkhi Festival is an annual spiritual journey in Maharashtra where thousands of devotees walk together in devotion to Lord Vithoba of Pandharpur.
Originating over 700 years ago, it reflects Maharashtra’s deep-rooted bhakti movement traditions and community harmony.

highlights.title: Mass Pilgrimage
highlights.description: Devotees travel hundreds of kilometers on foot carrying the palkhi (palanquin).

highlights.title: Devotion and Discipline
highlights.description: A unique blend of spirituality, culture, and selflessness.

geography.intro: The Palkhi Yatra travels from Alandi and Dehu to Pandharpur, covering hundreds of kilometers through villages and towns.

climate.description: Held during the early monsoon, devotees experience both heat and rain.

geography.conclusion: The Palkhi Festival symbolizes Maharashtra’s faith, endurance, and collective devotion.

activities.title: Abhanga Singing
activities.description: Devotees sing devotional hymns throughout the journey.

activities.title: Walking with Devotees
activities.description: Join the palkhi procession to experience true spiritual unity.
info: Participate for a day or the entire journey.

attractions.title: Alandi & Dehu
attractions.description: Birthplaces of Saints Dnyaneshwar and Tukaram.

attractions.title: Pandharpur
attractions.description: Final destination, home to the famous Vithoba temple.

marineLife.intro: Not applicable for this cultural event.

items.title: Cultural Harmony
items.description: Pilgrims share food, prayers, and songs irrespective of caste or status.

conclusion: The Palkhi Yatra is a moving example of Maharashtra’s living spirituality.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Pune or Pandharpur.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Regular state transport buses connect all pilgrimage points.
